I played this game a lot, like a few hundred hours and got quite into it, but there are several things which make this a game I wouldn't reccommend. 
1. The player hosted servers are broken or extremely hard to set up or load into, so you have to play public matches
2. Random people can join public matches at any time (including just before the end of the game)
3. If you don't start the game at the start, you have almost no hope of winning. 
4. The kick voting system somehow doesnt kick a 2 on 0 vote but a 3 on 1 vote it does. 
5. There is FPS lag whenever you shoot a strong gun/fast weapon e.g. flamethrower.
6. Solo game gets extremely boring and the zombie spawns are predictable
7. A DLC weapon can do teamdamage allowing people to teamkill. 
8. The community has hardly any people and the people who do play it are mostly kids and people who either don't understand English or refuse to communicate.
9. The number of zombies spawned and the spawn locations differ with different people, meaning if someone runs around without communicating to you where they are, zombies can spawn and surround and kill you.
10. People who are maximum level joining normal games to crash them purposely
11. People who are maximum level joining normal games and asking for money.
12. People who are maximum level joining and killstealing/xp stealing from newbies/other players.
This is just the start of this, you can ask me if you'd like to know more.
However, if it wasn't for the community and shitty design, I would rate this game a solid 7/10, but due to its poor design/matchmaking/community it only deserves a 3/10 at best.

Killiing floor is a simple game. You and 5 others kill zeds. If you work together as a team you will survive. If you don't...
I love the six simple classes you don't really need much more than that in a game like this. The guns and characters are both fun and creative. I also like how this game will really challenge you when you turn up the difficulty. Some games are just too easy, not Killing Floor.

One of my favourite survival titles)

[b]Good things about it:[/b]
[list][*]Pretty easy to get along.
[*]Decent atmosphere of apocalypse.
[*]Hell of a lot fun with a different perks.
[*]Lots of weapons.
[*]Excellent british accent.
[/list]

[b]Not so good things about it:[/b]
[list][*]The best expirience is achieved when playing wih full team of balanced perks.
[*]Leveling some perks is a real korean grind (leveling Commando, for example, can take months).
[*]Some things are only purchasable, no other ways to unlock them.
[/list]
Прикольная игра 8/10

This game is a highly addictive shooter survival game. Fight wave after wave of Silent Hill like monsters. Claws, swords, rockets, fat people, and hands. All coming at you like a Black Friday morning. I do think the DLC's are a bit over priced even with a 50% discount. The camos cost as much as new weapons which is crazy. If the lowered the price for the DLC's (Which they won't) I would buy more of them. Yet I still highly recommend this game if you're looking for a fun fps, horror, and co-op game this is the best you can get.

Hey Community,



zwischen den Wellen hat der Gamer eine kurze Verschnaufpause, in der er Sachen erwerben kann. Diese variiert je nach Schwierigkeitsgrad in der Länge. Der Händler ändert nach jeder Welle seine Position, was Bewegung ins Spiel bringt. Der Gamer kann jede Runde mit einer anderen Klasse bestreiten. Jede Klasse hat ihre Vorzüge und kann aufsteigen. Dadurch verbessern sich die Vorzüge der Klasse prozentual.

Ein weiteres Plus von Killing Floor ist das Aussehen eurer Charaktere. Egal welche Klasse ihr wählt, ihr habt sehr sehr viele Möglichkeiten euch zu Kleiden. Vom Militärischen Aussehen über Seuchenbekämpfer, Polizei, Manager mit Gasmaske, Punk, Steampunk, oder anders gesagt: ALLE Aussehensmöglichkeiten die Irgendwie mit der Zombieapokalypse, Darkwave oder Industrial zu tun haben finden sich zur Auswahll! Auch die Auswahl an Maps ist riesig. 


Fazit: Ein Muss für alle Apokalypse Fans da draussen!

The game is not so bad, I liked some ideas. But at the end I have to say No. I managed to gain some perk experience but now it does not progress anymore, i.e. it's not saved upon match ending. I don't know whether it's bug or I need to play on some specific servers, but perks are obviously essential part of the game and experience saving must be fixed or game should clearly warn me if it will not save gained experience on specific servers.
Also I don't like aestetics. I know, it's subjective, but hell, this ugly freaking zombie as desktop icon? I don't want to look at it. Icons should be more neutral.

Still playing boring cod zombies? Well turn that off and play this instead. 


Anyways,Killing floor feels like a mix of left 4 dead 2 and cod zombies a little. Killing floor has more to offer than those other games. Killing floor was so great that i played all the time. I even installed lots and lots of mods for killing floor. Even this game contains lots of DLC's which are great and bad. 

Hands down though,Because Killing floor 2 does not have much to offer than the first game. The first game was alot better than the second one due to the first game having alot of stuff that it offers.

I have been playing killing floor since around the beginning of 2016 and when i first played it,It became a zombie game that i have never seen the great stuff that it has to offer than any zombie game ever. Killing floor is unlike any ever zombie i have played.

Buying this game will just amaze you.

10/10

Honestly such a great game. For $4.99 give or take it's so fun. Co-op especially. Playing with friends is so fun and the monsters when I first got the game scared the crap out of me. Amazingly, I don't have such a great computer yet on lowest settings 16:9 1280x720 I can run the game smoothly just barely getting around 90 FPS. 

PC SPECS:

CPU (API): AMD A4-5000
GPU (CHIP): AMD 8330 HD Graphics
RAM: 8.00 GB DDR2/DDR3 (can't remember)

I love this game so much, I'm sure I'd probably have frame issues if I bought Killing Floor 2, but I can easily upgrade to a different PC. 

The rush I have getting into a level is amazing. Hardly any games I play now-a-days give me the rush this game does. I can't wait 'till I get better at this game so that I can play on a harder difficulty and get an EVEN BIGGER adrenaline rush.

Thank you so very much for creating this game. I'm glad it was made, and by the right people.

Two years ago when I finally got a decent laptop, I got Killing Floor at the insistence of a good friend. This game basically trained me to go from a scaredy cat trigger happy noob to decent shooter after many, many attempts. It solidified my love of Zombie co-op shooter games in general and although I've moved onto other games & neglected KF, I do love it, the atmosphere and challenges on every level were teeth grittingly fun. The Patriarch still scares the bejeezus out of me!
